snippet: Democrats say they are confronted with a difficult choice: go against the wishes of President Obama or defy voters who are overwhelmingly opposed to involving the United States in another unpredictable Middle East war.
abstract: Congressional Democrats, torn over involving United States in another unpredictable Middle East war, are emerging as major barrier to Pres Obama's plan to strike Syria; many of the president's core supporters are expressing the deepest reservations; say they are confronted with difficult choice of going against Obama, or defying voters who are overwhelmingly opposed to another American military intervention overseas.
lead_paragraph: Democrats say they are confronted with a difficult choice: go against the wishes of President Obama or defy voters who are overwhelmingly opposed to involving the United States in another unpredictable Middle East war.

headline.main: Obama Faces Barrier in His Own Party on Syria
headline.print_headline: Obama Faces Barrier in His Own Party on Syria
